page.title: 06Wildlife
page.content: This layman's view of the wildlife in the area is based on observations gathered while walking the area since 1980. The area is used intensively for agriculture and it is evident that this has an impact on the flora and fauna. Many hedges have been grubbed and field margins are sprayed with chemicals necessary for modern methods of farming.It is not unusual to see chemically damaged specimens of flowers in the field edges, primroses and violets in Spring and poppies in summer for example. However much of beauty survives often in woodland areas. Cowslips are still in a few places and when found with primroses ox slips may occur. Various orchids may be discovered, particularly in woodland, and bluebells smother the woodland floor in spring. Poppies brighten the summer fields.
